title: Penguin Random House’s Bid to Acquire Simon & Schuster Blocked by Judge
description: The government’s case blocked the merger of two of the United States’ largest publishers and reflected a more aggressive approach to curbing consolidation. It was closely watched by the publishing industry.
dc:creator: Alexandra Alter and Elizabeth A. Harris
media:description: Penguin Random House’s 100 or so imprints publish more than 2,000 titles a year. The merger would have added another 50 imprints from Simon & Schuster.
